speaker: CINNA
text:
I
               
              dreamt
               
              tonight
               
              that
               
              I
               
              did
               
              feast
               
              with
               
              Caesar
              ,

speaker: CINNA
text:
And
               
              things
               
              unluckily
               
              charge
               
              my
               
              fantasy
              .

speaker: CINNA
text:
I
               
              have
               
              no
               
              will
               
              to
               
              wander
               
              forth
               
              of
               
              doors
              ,

speaker: CINNA
text:
Yet
               
              something
               
              leads
               
              me
               
              forth
              .

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: What is your name?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Whither are you going?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Where do you dwell?

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Are you a married man or a

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: bachelor?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Answer every man directly.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Ay, and briefly.

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Ay, and wisely.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Ay, and truly, you were best.

speaker: CINNA
text: What is my name? Whither am I going? Where

speaker: CINNA
text: do I dwell? Am I a married man or a bachelor?

speaker: CINNA
text: Then to answer every man directly and briefly,

speaker: CINNA
text: wisely and truly: wisely I say, I am a bachelor.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: That’s as much as to say they are

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: fools that marry. You’ll bear me a bang for that, I

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: fear. Proceed directly.

speaker: CINNA
text: Directly, I am going to Caesar’s funeral.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: As a friend or an enemy?

speaker: CINNA
text: As a friend.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: That matter is answered directly.

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: For your dwelling—briefly.

speaker: CINNA
text: Briefly, I dwell by the Capitol.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Your name, sir, truly.

speaker: CINNA
text: Truly, my name is Cinna.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Tear him to pieces! He’s a conspirator.

speaker: CINNA
text: I am Cinna the poet, I am Cinna the poet!

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Tear him for his bad verses, tear him

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: for his bad verses!

speaker: CINNA
text: I am not Cinna the conspirator.

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: It is no matter. His name’s Cinna.

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Pluck but his name out of his heart, and turn him

speaker:
FOURTH
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: going.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Tear him, tear him! Come, brands, ho,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: firebrands! To Brutus’, to Cassius’, burn all! Some

speaker:
THIRD
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: to Decius’ house, and some to Casca’s, some to

speaker:
THIRD
               
              PLEBEIAN
text: Ligarius’. Away, go!
